Description: Painted pottery daily life shabti of Nakhtamun with a black curled lappet-wig, a modelled brown face with large white eyes, a black collar, crossed arms in relief with brown hands; the figure wears a white garment with elbow-length sleeves and a pleated triangular apron with two tiers, the lower of which is inscribed with a column of black painted hieroglyphs.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
